text: Eigenvalue problems and singular Value Decomposition Clicker 12: positive definiteness and singularity @ If a matrix is symmetric positive definite, then it is necessarily also nonsingular (invertible) @ If a matrix is symmetric positive definite, then it is necessarily singular @ If a matrix is symmetric positive definite, then we cannot determine ahead of time whether it is singular or nonsingular @ If a matrix is nonsingular, then it is necessarily symmetric positive definite @ If a matrix is singular, then it is necessarily symmetrix positive definite Ascher & Greif (UBC Computer Science) A First Course in Numerical Methods CPSC 302, Fall 2023 22/23
